questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lichtwitz Trocar Above image is of Lichtwitz trocar and cannula .

Highyeild:

Lichtwitz trocar and cannula . Used for proof of puncture (antral lavage). Puncture is done in the inferior meatus as this site is easily accessible and safe.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Macewen's Curette Option C. Farabeuf Periosteal Elevator Option D. Mastoid Gouge

questions.text: What is the name of the instrument?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Montgomery T Tube The above image is of the Montgomery T tube.

Highyeild:

Montgomery T tube The Montgomery T-tube is a silicone stent with a long central lumen and a smaller lumen projecting from the side of the stent at either a 90 or 75 angle. It is used to stent the larynx and trachea after reconstruction for areas of malacia and stenosis. It is a soft stent and can be left in place for periods over 12 months. Its main advantage is that the patient can speak. It is prone to crusting, and to counteract this, it is best to plug the side lumen as much as possible and intermittently perform proper suctioning to prevent blockage. It is not used in children under two years of age as the small size of the stent required has too narrow an internal diameter and can easily become blocked.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Tracheostomy Tube Option C. Blom Singer Prosthesis

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding this instrument are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Diameter of the central hole is 19mm

options.label: B
options.text: Diameter of the mirror is 89 mm

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mirror used is convex. The above image is of the head mirror . It has a concave mirror, not a convex mirror.

Highyeild:

HEAD MIRROR It is a concave mirror that reflects light from the Bull’s eye lamp onto the examined part. It has a focal length of approximately 25 cm. The examiner sees through the hole in the centre of the mirror. The diameter of the mirror is 89 mm (31⁄2“), and that of the central hole is 19 mm (3/4”). Illumination sources include electric headlights connected to a main power source through a step-down transformer or chargeable batteries.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- O ption A. Diameter of the central hole is 19mm is a true statement. O ption B. Diameter of the mirror is 89 mm is also a true statement. O ption C. Focal length is 250mm is also a true statement.
